snippet: Some New Jersey towns, which lost residents during the 2001 attacks, are moving from large outdoor commemorations, to a personal “day of remembrance.”
abstract: Some communities in the New York area that lost residents during the Sept 11 attacks are transitioning from large outdoor commemorations to more private acts of remembrance; New York City will also scale back its memorial ceremonies, change for which Mayor Michael R Bloomberg has drawn criticism.
lead_paragraph: Some New Jersey towns, which lost residents during the 2001 attacks, are moving from large outdoor commemorations, to a personal “day of remembrance.”

headline.seo: This Year, Some Towns Are Scaling Back 9/11 Memorials
headline.main: For Some, Moving On From 9/11 Means Scaling Back
headline.print_headline: To Move On From 9/11, Some Scale Back
